problem: Question: Portfolio A consists of a one-year zero-coupon bond with a face value of $2,000 and a 10-year zero-coupon bond with a face value of $6,000. Portfolio B consists of a 5.95-year zero-coupon bond with a face value of $5,000. The current yield on all bonds is 10% per annum.What is the percentage reduction in the value of Portfolio B when yields increase by 5%?
answer: The value of Portfolio B falls by approximately 12.02% when the yield increases from 10% to 15%.
reasoning: Using the zero-coupon bond pricing formula PV = Face / (1 + y)^T, the present value of Portfolio B at 10% is PV_B_10 ≈ 2813.14 and at 15% is PV_B_15 ≈ 2474.92 (steps S6, S7, S7_calc). The decrease in value is 2813.14 − 2474.92 = 338.22 (steps S8, S8_calc). The percentage reduction is (338.22 / 2813.14) × 100 ≈ 12.02% (steps S9, S9_calc), which is consistent with bond price sensitivity to higher yields.

state.problem: Question: Portfolio A consists of a one-year zero-coupon bond with a face value of $2,000 and a 10-year zero-coupon bond with a face value of $6,000. Portfolio B consists of a 5.95-year zero-coupon bond with a face value of $5,000. The current yield on all bonds is 10% per annum.What is the percentage reduction in the value of Portfolio B when yields increase by 5%?
state.goal: Compute the percentage reduction in the value of Portfolio B when the yield on all bonds increases from 10% to 15%, and express the final answer as a percentage (e.g., as a numeric value with an appropriate level of precision).
givens: Portfolio A: one-year zero-coupon bond with face value $2,000
Portfolio A: 10-year zero-coupon bond with face value $6,000
Portfolio B: 5.95-year zero-coupon bond with face value $5,000
Current yield on all bonds: 10% per annum
New yield after increase: 15% per annum (i.e., 10% + 5%)
All instruments are zero-coupon bonds (no intermediate coupons)
unknowns: Present value of Portfolio B at 10% yield
Present value of Portfolio B at 15% yield
Absolute change in the value of Portfolio B when yield increases from 10% to 15%
Percentage reduction in the value of Portfolio B (relative to its value at 10%)
invariants: Use annual compounding for discounting zero-coupon bonds unless otherwise specified.
Face values are denominated in USD; calculations should be consistent in currency units.
All yields are per annum and expressed in decimal form for calculation (e.g., 0.10, 0.15).
Use the standard present value formula for zero-coupon bonds: PV = Face / (1 + y)^T.
No mental math: any arithmetic, powers, or divisions must be computed using Python.
Final percentage reduction should be clearly labeled as a percentage (not a decimal).
Do not compute or use any values for Portfolio A unless later required; focus on Portfolio B for this question.

plan.title: Extract key data and confirm objective
plan.description: Summarize the essential numerical inputs (face value, maturity, initial yield, new yield) specifically for Portfolio B and restate the computation goal: to find the percentage reduction in Portfolio B's present value when the yield increases from 10% to 15%. No calculations here.
plan.expected_output: A clear list: face value of Portfolio B, time to maturity (years), initial yield, new yield, and a short statement of the target output (percentage reduction).
plan.result:
Portfolio B key data and objective:
- Face value: $5,000
- Time to maturity: 5.95 years
- Initial yield: 10% per annum
- New yield after increase: 15% per annum
\nObjective: Determine the percentage reduction in the present value of Portfolio B when the yield increases from 10% to 15%.

plan.title: Check units and compounding assumptions
plan.description: Verify that all inputs use consistent units: yields per annum, maturity in years, face value in dollars. State the compounding assumption (annual, using PV = Face/(1+y)^T) and confirm that these conventions will be used for all subsequent calculations.
plan.expected_output: A brief confirmation that units are consistent (years, annual yields, dollars) and that the annual compounding zero-coupon formula will be used.
plan.result: All inputs are in consistent units: face value in dollars ($5,000), maturity in years (5.95 years), and yields as annual rates (10% and 15% per annum). We will use annual compounding for a zero-coupon bond with the formula PV = Face / (1 + y)^T for all subsequent calculations.

plan.title: Write symbolic formula for Portfolio B value at 10%
plan.description: Express the present value of Portfolio B at the initial 10% yield in symbolic form using the zero-coupon PV formula, but do not yet insert numerical values or compute them.
plan.expected_output: An algebraic expression for PV_B_10 in terms of Face_B, yield_10, and T_B, such as PV_B_10 = Face_B / (1 + yield_10)^T_B.
plan.result:
Let Face_B be the face value of Portfolio B, yield_10 be the initial yield, and T_B be the time to maturity. The present value at 10% is given symbolically by:
\nPV_B_10 = Face_B / (1 + yield_10)^{T_B}.

plan.title: Write symbolic formula for Portfolio B value at 15%
plan.description: Express the present value of Portfolio B at the new 15% yield symbolically, again using the zero-coupon PV formula, without performing computations.
plan.expected_output: An algebraic expression for PV_B_15 in terms of Face_B, yield_15, and T_B, such as PV_B_15 = Face_B / (1 + yield_15)^T_B.
plan.result:
Let Face_B be the face value of Portfolio B, yield_15 be the new yield, and T_B be the time to maturity. The present value at 15% is given symbolically by:
\nPV_B_15 = Face_B / (1 + yield_15)^{T_B}.

plan.title: Substitute numerical inputs into the PV formulas
plan.description: Substitute the given numerical values for Face_B ($5,000), T_B (5.95 years), yield_10 (0.10), and yield_15 (0.15) into the symbolic expressions for PV_B_10 and PV_B_15, but do not yet evaluate the numeric results. This step sets up the exact numeric expressions to be computed.
plan.expected_output: Explicit formulas such as PV_B_10 = 5000 / (1.10)^5.95 and PV_B_15 = 5000 / (1.15)^5.95 written out clearly.

plan.expected_output: A numeric value for PV_B_10 (present value at 10% yield), with appropriate precision noted.

plan.title: Compute the percentage reduction in value

plan.title: Sanity and consistency check
plan.description: Check whether the direction and magnitude of the percentage change are sensible: (a) confirm that the value at 15% is less than at 10%, (b) ensure the percentage reduction is positive and within a plausible range (not greater than 100%), and (c) verify that all units (years, percent per annum, dollar amounts) were used consistently throughout.
plan.expected_output: A brief justification that the result is reasonable (e.g., higher yield implies lower price, the magnitude is not extreme) and that there are no unit or sign inconsistencies.
